intro: Pedicularis griniformis, commonly known as the grin-faced monkeyflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble a grinning face, with elongated petals forming the eyes and a curved lower lip. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
